abstracts.cdata!:
This Second Economic Management and
            Growth Credit Project's reform program and objectives
            aim to facilitate Zambia by: 1) maintaining and deepening
            Zambia's macroeconomic framework conducive to robust
            growth; 2) strengthening the credibility and institutional
            capacity of the public sector; and 3) enhancing
            Zambia's growth opportunities while improving its
            poverty impact. The FY04-07 CAS envisages that over the
            four-year period of CAS implementation, there could be two
            multi-tranche Development Policy Lending Operations or one
            multi-tranche plus two single tranche development policy
            operations (DPOs) to support CAS implementation. IDA and the
            Government of the Republic of Zambia agree that achieving
            these objectives in part depend on the implementation of
            specific reforms in the areas of: (i) public sector
            management; (ii) macro economic management including the
            reduction of arrears and the establishment of a credit
            rating bureau; (iii) agriculture; (iv) infrastructure; and
            (v) business environment.
